initial.narrative: A patient which is <%Patient.hasAge.Age%> presents with <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Wheeze%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Breathing-Condition%> <%Patient.givesHistory.Cough%>. What is the possible diagnosis?
initial.explanation: Wheeze together with either difficulty breathing or history of cough are symptoms of asthma.

severity.narrative: On examination of a patient with possible asthma, you find <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Oxygen-Saturation%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Central-Cyanosis%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Inability-To-Drink%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Consciousness%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Inability-To-Talk%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Pulse-Rate%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Lower-Chest-Wall-Indrawing%> <%Patient.undergoesExamination.Respiratory-Rate%>
severity.explanation:
SEVERE ASTHMA:
Oxygen saturation <90%,
central cyanosis,
inability to drink,
AVPU = V, P or U,
inability to talk,
pulse rate > 200 bpm (0-3 years) and >180 bpm (4-5 years).

MILD or MODERATE ASTHMA: 
wheeze 
PLUS 
lower chest wall indrawing
OR
RR => 50/min (2-11months)
RR =>40/min (12-59months)
RR=>30/min (5-12years)

management.narrative: You make a diagnosis of <%Patient.hasDiagnosis.Diagnosis.hasSeverity.Severity%> <%Patient.hasDiagnosis.Diagnosis.hasDiagnosisName.DiagnosisName%>. What of the following is the correct to do?
management.explanation: A patient with a severe asthma should be admitted into the hospital. For mild or moderate, don't admit.
